dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4153 IH: STRONG Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Alford (for himself and Mr. Wied) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Small Business

form.official-title: To amend the Small Business Act and the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to increase the maximum loan amount for certain loans, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Supporting Trade and Rebuilding Opportunity for National Growth Act or the STRONG Act.

section.header: Maximum loan amount for a 7(a) loan
section.text: Section 7(a)(3)(A) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 636(a)(3)(A)) is amended by striking $3,750,000 (or if the gross loan amount would exceed $5,000,000) and inserting $7,500,000 (or if the gross loan amount would exceed $10,000,000).

section.header: Maximum loan amount for a development company loan
section.text: Section 502(2)(A) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 (15 U.S.C. 696(2)(A)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by striking $5,000,000 each place it appears and inserting $10,000,000; and
by striking $5,500,000 each place it appears and inserting $10,000,000.
